hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabar ibn Zayd: A man came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I have a maidservant who tends my sheep. When I came to her, she was found to have lost one of the sheep from the flock. I asked her about it, and she said: 'The wolf ate it.' I became angry and grieved at this until I struck her face, and upon me is a slave-freeing obligation. Should I free her?' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'If she comes, bring her to me.' The man brought her to the Prophet ﷺ, and the Prophet ﷺ asked her: 'Who is your Lord?' She said: 'Allah is my Lord.' He asked: 'Who is your Prophet?' She said: 'You are Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah.' The Prophet ﷺ said to the man: 'Free her, for she is a believer.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabar ibn Zayd from Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas: The Prophet ﷺ came to visit me during the Farewell Pilgrimage, visiting me from a pain that had intensified upon me. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I have reached a point of pain such as you see. I am a man of property and I have only a single daughter as an heir. May I give charity with two-thirds of my wealth?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Then with half?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Then with one-third?' He said: 'Yes, one-third is sufficient. For one-third is much. Indeed if you leave your heirs wealthy it is better than leaving them in need, begging from the people. And whatever expense you spend with the intention of seeking Allah's pleasure, you shall be rewarded for it, even if you spend on your wife.' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, shall I remain behind after my companions?' He said: 'You shall not be left behind but will perform good deeds and gain higher ranks and honor. Perhaps you will remain so that some people will benefit from you and others will be harmed by you. O Allah, complete the migration of my companions, do not turn them back on their heels - but the poor Sa'd ibn Khawlah is pitiable [he died in Makkah].' The Prophet ﷺ expressed regret for him because he died in Makkah. Al-Rabi' explains: The meaning of 'some will benefit from you and others will be harmed' is that when Sa'd was appointed over Iraq, he fought those who apostatized and struck them. He called others who were copying the rhyming speech of Musaylimah the Liar to repent, and they repented and benefited from him. And his saying 'struck them' means he killed them by striking.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabar from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ: My beloved Gabriel ﷺ commanded me to treat slaves with kindness until I thought that no human being would ever be enslaved, and he commanded me to honor neighbors until I thought there was nothing about them to be hidden. Al-Rabi' [narrates]: While I was striking a slave boy of mine with a whip, I heard a voice from behind saying: 'Know, Abu Mas'ud.' I was so angry that I could not understand anything until the Messenger of Allah ﷺ came to me. When I saw him, the whip fell from my hand. He said: 'Know, Abu Mas'ud, that Allah has power over you as you have power over this slave boy.' I said: 'By the One who sent you with the truth, I will never strike a slave again.'

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Ubaidah said: I heard some Companions narrating from the Prophet ﷺ: Sins are of two types: a sin between a servant and his Lord, and a sin between a servant and another person. As for the sin between the servant and his Lord - if he repents from it, he becomes like one who has no sin. But as for a sin between him and another person, he cannot repent from it until he returns the wronged goods to its owner.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabar ibn Zayd: It reached me that the Prophet ﷺ forbade walking in crops, and said: Only three may walk in it - the one who waters it, the one who harvests it, or the one who guards it. Al-Rabi' explains: The guardian is the protector, and the one who harvests is he who removes the herbage from it. Abu Ubaidah from the path of Ibn Umar said: The Prophet ﷺ said: Let none of you milk the livestock of another without permission. Would any of you like if someone came to your storage, broke open your container, and took your food? The udders of their livestock are their storage containers for their food. It is not permissible to milk another's livestock without permission. Al-Rabi' from Ubadah ibn al-Samit said: The Prophet ﷺ said: Return the needle and thread, and beware of illicit taking, for it is disgrace upon its people on the Day of Judgment.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabar from Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said: Beware of suspicion, for suspicion is the most deceptive of talk. Do not spy on one another, do not eavesdrop on one another, do not compete with one another, do not envy one another, do not turn away from one another, and be servants of Allah as brothers. Al-Rabi' explains: Do not spy - meaning do not follow after one another's private matters. Do not eavesdrop - meaning do not walk with gossip. Do not compete - meaning do not take revenge upon one another for what is inherent in their nature.
